actions-list.header: Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to Senate Concurrent Resolution 34, 118th Congress, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies: Mr. Johnson of Louisiana, Mr. Scalise and Mr. Jeffries.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on May 20, 2024, at 1:55 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.J. Res. 109. Appointment: United States Commission on International Religious Freedom.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 21.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable David Kustoff to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
